page.title: 01Southern St.Leonards/Pebsham
page.content: The area covered comprises southern St.Leonard's-on-Sea,the rural area west of this,some of which is very low-lying and marshy,and the eastern part of Pebsham estate.The southern area is the English Channel,abutting the urban coastal strip from De La Warr Road in the west to Marine Court flats in the east via Glyne Gap, Bulverhythe and Marina.Roughly half is urban,half rural,with most houses in the east and south of the area.These vary in age and type.Very few now standing were built before Victorian times,except those near St.Leonard's town centre.Many are 20th.century. Development continues.Prices are relatively low as jobs are short and road and rail links with London and other population centres are comparatively poor.Some woodland survives in the north of the area.
